title: A New Drug Switched Off My Appetite. What’s Left?

last_post.content:
In my most recent column for WIRED I describe my experience with Mounjaro, a new drug for type 2 diabetics that deeply manipulates satiety, with a side effect of radical weight loss.

Fat is a vast subject involving economics, agriculture, race, gender, sexuality, cultural norms, psychology, biology, even climate. In contrast I'm relating an individual, fragmentary experience, in a state of confusion, at a moment of vulnerability. I'm sure it will go great.

https://www.wired.com/story/new-drug-switched-off-appetite-mounjaro/

title: Journalistic Lessons for the Algorithmic Age – The Markup

last_post.content:
I’m sad to announce that I am leaving @themarkup to pursue other projects, which I will announce soon.

It was an honor and a privilege to found @themarkup five years ago to create an investigative newsroom that integrated engineers and journalists. We showed the world what journalism could be: math literate, computationally superpowered, and human-centered.

On my departure, I thought I would reflect on the ten lessons I learned leading these investigations. https://themarkup.org/hello-world/2023/02/04/journalistic-lessons-for-the-algorithmic-age

title: 4chan users embrace AI voice clone tool to generate celebrity hatespeech

last_post.content:
It's 2023. "Gosh, we didn't realize how people would misuse this" just isn't believable anymore.

Bare minimum, with any new tech:
1) How would a stalker use this?
2) What will 4chan do with this?

And don't release, not even as alpha or beta, before mitigating those risks.

https://www.theverge.com/2023/1/31/23579289/ai-voice-clone-deepfake-abuse-4chan-elevenlabs

title: Is cycling safe? In many cases, the answer is no.

last_post.content:
Very big implications to finding (2 studies, in London & Paris) that woman cyclists get killed more than men because they wait for signal to start across intersection.
This is surely true for pedestrians too, since geometry is the same.
Implies that using marked crosswalk & obeying signal is often more dangerous than violating law. 1/2

Some brand new features in this release:
- the fuzzy_join function to join tables on imprecise matches;
- the FeatureAugmenter, a scikit-learn Transformer for joining multiple tables with dirty categories;

You can install it:

pip install dirty-cat==0.4.0b1

Try it and give us feedback!

And check-out the examples on:
https://dirty-cat.github.io/dev/

@nyrath To avoid confusion here: Jourdan et al. 2023 did not measure the age of the object we know as Itokawa. They measure the time since grains in the Itokawa dust sample were hit by a ~10 gigapascal shock: https://www.pnas.org/doi/abs/10.1073/pnas.2214353120 .

Objects like Itokawa mostly reconfigure and break up due to radiation pressure torques (the YORP effect). That is a much more gradual process and gives the current asteroid a lifetime of just ~10 million years. Per Lowry et al. 2014 - https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/abs/2014/02/aa22602-13/aa22602-13.html .

title: Scottish university press slashes open access monograph costs

last_post.content:
Although I think the Scottish University Press is an excellent initiative, I'm also worried about how these new OA book publishers are reported as being 'cheaper' than commercial publishers. It's similar to the flurry of new presses launched around the time of the RCUK policy in 2013, all claiming to undercut the price of traditional journals. Focusing on market outcomes will only benefit commercial publishers, which is exactly what happened with journal publishing and seems likely to be the effect of national OA mandates for books too.

We need to change this narrative by emphasising the community-led nature of such initiatives, the care they take in publishing, and the fact they offer an escape from marketisation not a mere rehearsal of it.

https://www.timeshighereducation.com/news/scottish-university-press-slashes-open-access-monograph-costs

title: Petition: Do not remove LGBT content from the Relationships Education curriculum

last_post.content:
I am going to keep posting about this until we get to 100,000 signatures.

I apologise if you have seen posts like this before and you are getting bored of seeing it. However, I did promise you that I would keep posting and we are not there yet.

As I write there are 87,306 signatures. The linear trend line of signatures from Tuesday 31 January gives an equation of y = 1661.4x + 81030. If we can keep up this rate then we will hit 100,000, and I can stop bothering you, on Sunday 12 February. It would be really lovely if we could get there sooner.

Please sign if you are in the UK and please boost if you are not.

May I take this opportunity to thank each and everyone of the 600 people that have boosted this post so far. ❤️

title: An epic journey across 18 European cities, inspired by James Joyce’s Ulysses - Ulysses

last_post.content:
!!KLEINES STIPENDIUM ZU VERGEBEN!! - VON UNS UND RIMINI PROTOKOLL!

Wir laden zwei junge "emerging artists" ein, an einem Recherchereise-Programm mitzumachen, was im Rahmen einer Kooperation von Peng! und Rimini Protokoll stattfindet, finanziert mit Mitteln der EU im Rahmen des Projekts European Odyssey. Mehr dazu unter https://ulysseseurope.eu/ . Idealerweise sollten die Personen einen starken Bezug zu subversiver Aktionskunst haben und journalistische sowie künstlerische Rechercheskills mitbringen. Außerdem soll in der Bewerbung ein Interesse für die spezifische Stadt und das Thema Europa zum Ausdruck gebracht werden. Thematisch geht es uns um das Thema Amazon als Unternehmen und Gig-Ökonomie und wir würden die Personen gerne mit ein paar Fragen und Anregungen ausstatten und sehr gern etwas von ihnen lernen über ihre Erfahrungen damit vor Ort. Es werden zwar generell keine Arbeitsergebnisse erwartet, das Programm dient zuvorderst einer Unterstützung der Künstler*innen zur Erweiterung der eigenen Netzwerke - wie es bei Netzwerken aber so ist, sind sie bei freudiger Zusammenarbeit aber besonders nachhaltig und wir wären interessiert daran, einen kleinen Input infolge der Recherche im Rahmen eines Kongresses am 1.Juni in Berlin zum Thema zu präsentieren. Finanziert werden eine Reise zu und Unterkunft in Budapest oder Kopenhagen im Mai 2023, sowie 1000 Euro Honorar brutto. Einzige Verpflichtung für die Stipendiaten besteht darin, am Veranstaltungs-Programm der gastgebenden Partner-Institutionen in der jeweiligen Stadt teilzunehmen.
Bewerbungen bis inkl. 14.2.2023 samt CV bitte in Englischer Sprache an: amazon@peng.gg
